div.head: Sand, slate, and burned earth
div.ab: Thoroughly burnt sand loses its bond. Slate is reheated & molds neatly. Next, it is true that it often becomes porous, as burned earth also does, as fatty sand also does.
I find that one ought not to knock on very finely ground sands, for it shakes them loose & make prevents them from releasing neatly. But one ought to press hard and moisten them sufficiently.
